title: 106_s630
content: TRANSFER OF RESPONSIBILITY FOR OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE FLATHEAD IRRIGATION PROJECT, MONTANA. The purpose of this Act is to preserve family farms and ranches in Montana by transferring responsibility for the Flathead Irrigation Project without affecting water rights negotiations. Definitions include "contract" and "irrigation district." The Act aims to transfer responsibility for the Flathead Irrigation Project without impacting water rights negotiations. Definitions include "contract" and "irrigation district." The Act of May 10, 1926 defines terms related to the irrigation systems on the Flathead Indian Reservation in Montana, including the project and the Secretary of the Interior. The Act of May 10, 1926 defines terms related to the Flathead Irrigation Project, including the Secretary of the Interior and the Confederated Salish and Kootenai Tribes of the Flathead Nation. The Secretary is required to offer a contract within a year of the Act's enactment. The Salish and Kootenai Tribes of the Flathead Nation, a federally recognized tribe, may enter into a contract with the irrigation district to operate and manage the project within a year of the Act's enactment. The Salish and Kootenai Tribes of the Flathead Nation, a federally recognized tribe, may enter into a contract with the irrigation district to operate and manage the project, including all rights and powers exercised by the Secretary, and identify trust responsibilities of the United States to the Tribe affected by the operation and maintenance of the Irrigation Division. The contract between the Salish and Kootenai Tribes and the irrigation district must include provisions identifying the trust responsibilities of the United States to the Tribe affected by the operation of the Irrigation Division and ensuring that these responsibilities are fulfilled. Additionally, it must ensure that the irrigation district maintains the interim instream flows established by the Bureau of Indian Affairs to preserve fisheries. The contract between the Salish and Kootenai Tribes and the irrigation district must include provisions to fulfill the United States' trust responsibilities to the Tribe and maintain instream flows for fisheries. Indian Affairs must preserve fisheries during water rights adjudication and comply with any rulings. Existing repayment obligations for project construction costs will continue if the irrigation district makes a $1,000,000 accelerated payment on the contract with the United States. The construction costs of the project will continue unaffected if the irrigation district makes a $1,000,000 accelerated payment on the repayment contract with the United States by December 31, 2001. Repayment contracts between the irrigation district and the United States will be amended to ensure that net revenues from the Power Division operation will not be used for operation expenses. The irrigation district must make a $1,000,000 accelerated payment by December 31, 2001 to keep construction costs unaffected. Repayment contracts will be amended to prevent using Power Division revenues for operation expenses, with provisions for contract revocation if the district mismanages the project. The irrigation district must make a $1,000,000 accelerated payment by December 31, 2001 to keep construction costs unaffected. Repayment contracts will be amended to prevent using Power Division revenues for operation expenses, with provisions for contract revocation if the district mismanages the project, including willingly and knowingly damaging tribal trust assets. The project must be operated in a way that does not damage tribal trust assets, with the operation plan in effect on October 31, 1997 presumed to provide adequate protection. The operation of the project must protect tribal trust assets, with the plan in effect on October 31, 1997 presumed to be sufficient. Changes required due to new information or policies are not grounds for contract revocation unless the irrigation district refuses to comply. The contract cannot be revoked due to new information, administrative policies, judicial decisions, or negotiations unless the irrigation district refuses to comply. Negotiations with the irrigation district must begin promptly to finalize a contract within a year. The Secretary must start negotiations promptly with the irrigation district to finalize a contract within a year. The contract will transfer ownership of equipment and supplies paid for with project funds to the irrigation district. The Secretary must transfer ownership of equipment and supplies purchased with project funds to the irrigation district after the date of enactment of this Act. The Secretary will provide an inventory list of supplies and equipment purchased with operation and maintenance funds to the irrigation district. Ownership of real property rights to land, interests in land, and water rights will not be transferred to the irrigation district. This Act does not impact water rights negotiations between the State of Montana, the United States, and the Tribe.
